title: Job Motivation Design: Integrated Approach Based on Social Systems Models (Considering Civic Rights and Organizational Culture)

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level specialized knowledge and problem-solving skills, basic understanding of organizational human relations and institutional analysis, familiarity with fundamental concepts of civic rights and political structures within social systems
context.additional_context: A corporate job competency enhancement program operating in limited-technology environments, combining smartphone-based mobile learning platforms with offline workshops. Aims to improve learners' civic consciousness and organizational culture adaptability, with a focus on strengthening the organization's social responsibility within the community.

learning_goals: Learners analyze ≥3 motivation factors (economic, social, psychological) of organizational members and apply them to task design while considering civic rights and institutional structures within social systems.

Learners create a job training design document reflecting motivation factors based on a social system model and establish educational strategies considering political and economic relationships within organizations.

Learners use motivation assessment tools to develop customized intervention strategies accounting for team cultural dynamics and rights structures, proposing improvements to power relationships within organizations.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
